text: Chirmol (also known as chismol or chirimol) is a common Central American cuisine or condiment topping on foods such as carne asada. == Preparation == Chimol is made of tomato, onion, bell pepper. It is seasoned with vinegar, lemon juice, salt, black pepper. Modifications to the recipe exist depending on different regions of Central America. == References == ==Links== *Chirmol|Chismol|Chimol radish - google.com/search Category:Guatemalan cuisine Category:Honduran cuisine Category:Salvadoran cuisine Category:Condiments
title: Chirmol
